We are strongly recommended to install “Envato Toolkit” plugin for ease of use. Once necessary plugin installed and activated “Envato Toolkit” menu will be available at your admin side.<strong>Important :</strong> If you have missing plugins or having issues to install any of them, all the related could be found under “recommended-plugins” folder within the downloaded package.<h3>User Account Information</h3>To obtain your API Key, visit your “My Settings” page on any of the Envato Marketplaces. Once a valid connection has been made any changes to the API key below for this username will not effect the results for 5 minutes because they’re cached in the database. If you have already made an API connection and just purchase a theme and it’s not showing up, wait five minutes and refresh the page. If the theme is still not showing up, it’s possible the author has not made it available for auto install yet.<strong>Marketplace Username:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace username.<strong>Secret API Key:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace Secret API Key (http://themeforest.net/user/[your-username]/api_keys/edit, Login to your Themeforest account, Settings &gt; API Key)<h3>Backup Information</h3>This plugin will automatically save your theme as a ZIP archive before it does an upgrade. The directory those backups get saved to is wp-content/envato-backups. However, if you’re experiencing problems while attempting to upgrade, it’s likely to be a permissions issue and you may want to manually backup your theme before upgrading. Alternatively, if you don’t want to backup your theme you can check the box below.<strong>Skip Theme Backup:</strong> Strongly recommended keep unchecked.<h3>Alternative Way</h3>You can also update the theme by replacing the old theme folder. First go to your theme directory then delete the theme folder and paste the new version of the theme.

Go to <em><strong><span style="color: #000000;">Appearance &gt; Customize &gt; Site Identity</span>.</strong></em> Then Select an image as site icon. It's recommended to use a <strong><em>.ico</em></strong> image as the site icon (favicon).<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2218 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png" alt="" width="461" height="501" /></a>&nbsp;

<!-- wp:paragraph --><p>You can control the theme's functionality and customize theme's content from the <em><strong>Theme Settings</strong> </em>page. Here you will find all relevant settings to customize the theme.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>This section will provide you an in-depth guide on how to use the Theme Options. To access the Theme Options page, go to-&nbsp;<strong><em>Dashboard &gt; Theme Settings.</em>&nbsp;</strong>You will find this page at the top of the <em><strong>Appearance</strong> </em>menu.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->
Before building your site, better take a look at this section.

In the Header settings section, you will get a lot of header customization options. In this section, you can change the logo and set the menu button, navigation bar settings etc.<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/header-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2189 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/header-2.png" alt="" width="1313" height="623" /></a>

You can configure the footer area of the theme from the settings option. You will find all relevant section settings to the "Footer" option. Navigate to <strong>Theme Options &gt; Footer Settings </strong>to go to this settings section. We provided all necessary instructions and descriptions with all the options.<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/footer-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2192 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/footer-2.png" alt="" width="1313" height="623" /></a>&nbsp;

Extract the zipped package downloaded from ThemeForest to your desktop, in the extracted package you will find the gullu<em>.zip</em> file which is the WordPress theme.You can install the theme in two ways:<pre><code>FTP: Extract gullu.zip file and upload the extracted folder to /wp-content/themes/ folder on your server.WordPress: Navigate to Appearance -&gt; Add New Themes -&gt; Upload page. Select gullu.zip file. Press the Install Now button to upload and install the theme.</code></pre>After uploading the theme, you have to activate it. Navigate to Appearance -&gt; Themes page to activate the theme.

<!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you want your site to look like exactly the 'Gullu' demos then you have to import the demo content successfully.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>We integrated the One Click Demo installation feature to 'Gullu' WordPress theme. You can import all demo content just by a click only.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>OneClick Demo Installation Process</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:list --><ul><li><a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/docs/gullu-wp/getting-started/theme-installation/">Install the theme</a> and activate it. Then install all the required plugins. Make sure all the required plugins are activated.</li><li>After activating all the required plugins navigate to<strong> <em>Appearance > 'One Click Demo Import'</em> </strong>menu from the WordPress dashboard.</li></ul><!-- /wp:list --><!-- wp:image {"id":2364,"linkDestination":"custom"} --><figure class="wp-block-image"><a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/gullu_demo_import_menu-2.png"><img src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/gullu_demo_import_menu-2.png" alt="" class="wp-image-2364"/></a></figure><!-- /wp:image --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong>Note:</strong>&nbsp;If the option data do not import then you have to import it manually. Navigate to<em> <strong>'Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong></em> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:image {"id":2227,"linkDestination":"custom"} --><figure class="wp-block-image"><a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/import-theme-options-2.png"><img src="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/import-theme-options-1024x486.png" alt="" class="wp-image-2227"/></a></figure><!-- /wp:image --><!-- wp:heading --><h2><strong>The recommended method to import the demo content.</strong></h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you failed to import the demo content by one click then you have to follow the below steps to import the demo content manually.&nbsp; You will get all demo content data with the theme package. You will find the demos in&nbsp;<em><strong>'gullu&gt;inc/demo{disired-demo-number} </strong></em>this path.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:list --><ul><li>Navigate to <strong><em>Tools &gt; Import</em> </strong>then install the WordPress plugin and click on the 'Run Importer'. Upload here the 'theme_content.xml' file.</li><li>Install the <em>'<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/widget-importer-exporter">Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</a>'</em> plugin to import the demo widgets. Then navigate to <strong><em>Tools &gt;&nbsp;Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</em></strong> and upload here the <em>'widget_data.wie'</em> file.</li><li>Now you have to import the Dental Options as like the demo. Navigate to '<strong>Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.</li></ul><!-- /wp:list -->

After installing the theme you most have to install the<strong> 'Gullu Core', 'Visual composer'</strong> and<strong> </strong><strong>'Codestar Framework'</strong> plugins to import the demo content as well and work the theme correctly.You will find all required and recommended plugins at <strong><em><span style="color: #000000;">Appearance &gt; Install Plugins.</span></em></strong>

In order to paginate your blog post, in the Write panel in your WordPress admin, switch to the TEXT view (if you are using the Visual view) and then enter the following code to wherever you want to break the post up into a new page:<pre>&lt;!--nextpage--&gt;</pre><img class="alignnone wp-image-2221 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/multi-pages-2.png" alt="" width="857" height="554">

The theme uses <a href="http://www.gravatar.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Gravatar</a> to display users avatars . to create or change your Gravatar :<h4>If you have never setup a Gravatar account:</h4><ol> 	<li>Register/login to <a href="http://www.gravatar.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Gravatar</a>. Upon registering, use the SAME email address that is associated with your WordPress User Profile.</li> 	<li>Upload your photo and associate it with that specific email address.</li></ol>&nbsp;<h4>If you already registered at gravatar.com, follow these steps:</h4><ol> 	<li>Click on "My Gravatars".</li> 	<li>click on "Add a New Email".</li> 	<li>Then, you'll need to click on "Add a New Image".</li> 	<li>Upload an image.</li> 	<li>Then select the email address, and then select your image from the bottom. Now it's associated with that email address. Click Save.</li> 	<li>It will take about 5-10 minutes to propagate on the internet, and then will appear on site.</li></ol>

<div class="container bs-docs-container"><div class="row"><div class="col-md-9"><div class="bs-docs-section">Optimizing your images will helps your WordPress site load faster.Download and activate <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-smushit/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WP Smush.it</a> This plugin will optimize every image you upload and you can use the Bulk Smush.it feature to smush all of your uploaded images.Alternatives to WP Smush.it include <a title="EWWW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/ewww-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">EWWW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="CW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/cw-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="Imsanity" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/imsanity/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Imsanity</a> and <a title="Hammy" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/hammy/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Hammy</a>. Many WordPress users prefer using these plugins as they do not rely on an external server to process your images.</div></div></div></div>

<p class="lead">All of our Themes are able to be translated into any language. The process of translating the theme is a user responsibility. The following instructions are given as guidance.</p><ol> 	<li>Open wp-config.php and replace this: <code>define ('WPLANG', ''); </code>with this (substitute the language string (bg_BG) with your own!): <code>define ('WPLANG', 'bg_BG');</code></li> 	<li>Download and install <a href="http://www.poedit.net/download.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">POEDIT</a></li> 	<li>Connect to your site -&gt; open your theme/languages directory</li> 	<li>Download the default.pot file and open it with POEDIT.</li> 	<li>Translate file and save it as bg_BG (the file name must match with the string you inserted into wp-config.php)</li> 	<li>Two files will be generated after save. bg_BG.pot and bg_BG.mo</li> 	<li>Upload the .mo and .pot files into wp-content/themes/your-theme/languages folder</li></ol><div class="bs-callout bs-callout-warning">Your WordPress installation should be in the language you intend on using the site.</div>

In the Header settings section, you will get a lot of header customization options. In this section, you can change the logo and change the page/post's Title bar padding, Page margin-top, Title bar overlay color etc.<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/theme_settings_header-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2239 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/theme_settings_header-2.png" alt="" width="1292" height="725" /></a>

You can configure the footer area of the theme from this settings option. You will find all relevant section settings to the “Footer Settings” option. Navigate to <strong>Theme Options &gt; Footer Settings </strong>to go to this settings section. We provided all necessary instructions and descriptions with all the options.<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/footer-settings-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2246 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/footer-settings-2.png" alt="" width="1352" height="876" /></a>

This section will introduce you how to use the <strong>Faster</strong>'s shortcodes.Those are our custom shortcodes developed and integrated with the Visual Composer (VC) plugin. So you can use our shortcodes with Visual Composer drag and drop interface.You will find all VC integrated shortcodes to VC Add Element popup box's "<strong>Faster" </strong>tab.<a href="http://wordpress.creativegigs.net/docly/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/shortcodes.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2251 size-full" src="http://wordpress.creativegigs.net/docly/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/shortcodes.png" alt="" width="1352" height="815" /></a>You can build a specific Faster design element with those shortcodes.You must have to install the required plugins "Faster Core", "CodeStar Framework" and "Visual Composer" to use all shortcodes as well. All shortcode elements will appear in Visual composer's shortcode elements popup box (Faster Tab). Take a look at the above screenshot to see all shortcodes.<strong>Note:</strong> You can import a demo and check to see how a shortcode working and displaying.

Extract the zipped package downloaded from ThemeForest to your desktop, in the extracted package you will find the <em>aprimo.zip</em> file which is the WordPress theme.You can install the theme in two ways:<pre><code>FTP: Extract aprimo.zip file and upload the extracted folder to /wp-content/themes/ folder on your server.WordPress: Navigate to Appearance -&gt; Add New Themes -&gt; Upload page. Select aprimo.zip file. Press the Install Now button to upload and install the theme.</code></pre>After uploading the theme, you have to activate it. Navigate to Appearance -&gt; Themes page to activate the theme.

You have to import the demo content successfully if you want your site look exactly like the <em><strong>'Aprimo'</strong></em> demo.We integrated the One Click Demo installation feature to '<strong><em>Aprimo</em></strong>' WordPress theme. You can import all demo contents just by a click only.<h2>OneClick Demo Installation Process</h2><ul> 	<li><a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/docs/gullu-wp/getting-started/theme-installation/">Install the theme</a> and active it. Then <a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/?p=2101">install</a> all required plugins. Make sure all the required plugins are activated.</li> 	<li>After activating all the required plugins navigate to<strong><span style="color: #000000;"> <em>Appearance &gt; 'One Click Demo Import'</em></span> </strong>menu from the WordPress dashboard.</li></ul><a href="http://wordpress.creativegigs.net/docly/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/demo_import_menu.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2362" src="http://wordpress.creativegigs.net/docly/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/demo_import_menu.png" alt="" width="1329" height="659" /></a><strong>Note:</strong> If the Theme Settings data do not import then you have to import it manually. Navigate to<em> <strong>'Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong></em> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file. You will find the options.txt in this path- <em><strong>inc/demo{disired-demo-number}/txt</strong></em><a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/settings-backup-2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2260" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/settings-backup-2.png" alt="" width="1352" height="815" /></a><strong>Find your page:</strong><div class="gmail_extra">Every demo has 3 pages including the  Default homepage, Gradient homepage, and the Particle background homepage. Navigate to Pages from your WordPress dashboard menu to see all pages. Take a look the below screenshot-</div><div class="gmail_extra"></div><div class="gmail_extra"><a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/image-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2368 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/image-2.png" alt="" width="1324" height="480" /></a></div><div class="gmail_extra">Navigate to <b><i>Settings &gt; Reading</i></b> to set your specific page as the front page (homepage).</div><h2><strong>The recommended method to import the demo content.</strong></h2>If you failed to import the demo content by one click then you have to follow the below steps to import the demo content manually. You will get all demo content data with the theme package. You will find the demos in <em><strong>'aprimo&gt;inc/demo{disired-demo-number}' </strong></em>this path.<ul> 	<li>Navigate to <strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Tools &gt; Import</em> </span></strong>then install the WordPress plugin and click on the 'Run Importer'. Upload here the 'contents.xml' file.</li> 	<li>Install the <em><span style="color: #000000;">'<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/widget-importer-exporter">Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</a>'</span></em> plugin to import the demo widgets. Then navigate to <strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Tools &gt; Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</em></span></strong> and upload here the <em><span style="color: #000000;">'widgets.wie'</span></em> file.</li> 	<li>Now you have to import the Dental Options as like the demo. Navigate to '<strong>Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.</li></ul>&nbsp;

After installing the theme you most have to install the<strong> 'Faster Core', 'Visual composer'</strong> and<strong> </strong><strong>'Codestar Framework'</strong> plugins to import the demo content as well and work the theme correctly.You will find all required and recommended plugins at there <strong><em><span style="color: #000000;">Appearance &gt; Install Plugins.</span></em></strong>

Upon registering, use the SAME email address that is associated with your WordPress User Profile.</li> 	<li>Upload your photo and associate it with that specific email address.</li></ol>&nbsp;<h4>If you already registered at gravatar.com, follow these steps:</h4><ol> 	<li>Click on "My Gravatars".</li> 	<li>click on "Add a New Email".</li> 	<li>Then, you'll need to click on "Add a New Image".</li> 	<li>Upload an image.</li> 	<li>Then select the email address, and then select your image from the bottom. Now it's associated with that email address. Click Save.</li> 	<li>It will take about 5-10 minutes to propagate on the internet, and then will appear on site.</li></ol>

Then Select the page template as <em><strong>"Contact Page"</strong></em> and click on the Publish button to create the Contact page.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:image {"id":3973,"sizeSlug":"large"} --><figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="http://wordpress.creativegigs.net/docly/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/home2-large-1024x807.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-3973"/></figure><!-- /wp:image --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Configuring the Contact page</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Go to <em><strong>Theme Settings &gt; Contact Page Settings&nbsp;</strong></em>from your&nbsp;WordPress dashboard to configure the Contact page settings. Here you will get everything you need to change the Contact page template.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->

Visual Composer is a unique plugin, it will help you manage your content on a WordPress site and create stunning layouts in few minutes without coding. Nowadays many websites have complex grid layouts with columns, tabs, sliders and etc. In the past, to create that type of layouts you should be HTML guru or Shortcodes operator ninja.You will get the Visual Composer plugin with our theme as pre-packaged. You can install it from <strong>“Appearance &gt; Install Plugins”.</strong>Here is the documentation with video tutorial <a href="http://kb.wpbakery.com/index.php?title=Visual_Composer" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Visual Composer Doc</a>

<div class="gmail_extra">You can control the space between rows from the visual composer's shortcode section settings.</div><div class="gmail_extra">Select the shortcode section from the Visual composer page edit screen (backend or frontend editor) that you want to control. Check the <b>Styling</b> tab from the visual composer's element settings. Take a look at the below screenshot of it-</div><div class="gmail_extra"> </div><div class="gmail_extra"><div><a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/image-2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2458" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/image-2.png" alt="" width="1197" height="585" /></a></div><div><span style="color: #000000;"><i> </i></span></div><div><span style="color: #000000;"><i>Note:  Input the padding (spaces around the section) as clockwise (Top Right Bottom Left)</i></span></div></div><!-- wp:paragraph --><p></p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->

We adding here solutions on regarding some common issues.You may find here your solution. So we request to check here for your issue before asking us.

Sometimes, your website may break when you update the new version of the theme.You have to delete the <strong>Gullu core</strong> plugin before installing the updated theme in this case. Then install the plugin again from <em><strong>Appearance &gt; Install plugins</strong> </em>after installing the new version.

<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/Screenshot_1-2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2331" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/Screenshot_1-2.png" alt="" width="1177" height="137"></a>This&nbsp;message appears when WooCommerce plugin changes any of its&nbsp;core files. Usually, this happens when WooCommerce publishes a major&nbsp;update or any minor update after the major&nbsp;update.&nbsp;<em>(Example. 3.3, 3.3.1)</em>We recommend clients&nbsp;to always read&nbsp;the changelog of your theme if the&nbsp;latest update of the theme supports that version of WooCommerce as noted in the plugin itself throughout the theme.[caption id="attachment_2333" align="alignnone" width="3072"]<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/woocommerce-update-notice-warning-scaled-1-2.jpg"><img class="wp-image-2333 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/woocommerce-update-notice-warning-scaled-1-2.jpg" alt="" width="3072" height="402"></a> If you recently updated WooCommerce, you might have spotted a notice like this on your Plugins page.[/caption]If you see that the latest version of the theme doesn’t support the&nbsp;released WooCommerce version then please wait until we release a theme update that will support the latest version&nbsp;of this plugin.If you accidentally updated the plugin then don’t worry, we probably are working on the update and when the&nbsp;theme update is ready you will be notified by&nbsp;email if you have already enabled.

If you want your site to look like exactly the 'Charles' demos then you have to import the demo content successfully.We integrated the One Click Demo installation feature to 'Charles' WordPress theme. You can import all demo content just by a click only.<h2>OneClick Demo Installation Process</h2><ul> 	<li><a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/docs/gullu-wp/getting-started/theme-installation/">Install the theme</a> and active it. Then <a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/?p=2101">install</a> all required plugins. Make sure all the required plugins are activated.</li> 	<li>After activating all the required plugins navigate to<strong><span style="color: #000000;"> <em>Appearance &gt; 'One Click Demo Import'</em></span> </strong>menu from the WordPress dashboard.</li></ul><a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/gullu_demo_import_menu-2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2364" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/gullu_demo_import_menu-2.png" alt="" width="1329" height="659" /></a><strong>Note:</strong> If the option data do not import then you have to import it manually. Navigate to<em> <strong>'Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong></em> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/import-theme-options-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2227 size-large" src="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/import-theme-options-1024x486.png" alt="" width="625" height="297" /></a><h2><strong>The recommended method to import the demo content.</strong></h2>If you failed to import the demo content by one click then you have to follow the below steps to import the demo content manually.  You will get all demo content data with the theme package. You will find the demos in <em><strong>'charles&gt;inc/demo{disired-demo-number} </strong></em>this path.<ul> 	<li>Navigate to <strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Tools &gt; Import</em> </span></strong>then install the WordPress plugin and click on the 'Run Importer'. Upload here the 'theme_content.xml' file.</li> 	<li>Install the <em><span style="color: #000000;">'<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/widget-importer-exporter">Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</a>'</span></em> plugin to import the demo widgets. Then navigate to <strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Tools &gt; Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</em></span></strong> and upload here the <em><span style="color: #000000;">'widget_data.wie'</span></em> file.</li> 	<li>Now you have to import the Dental Options as like the demo. Navigate to '<strong>Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.</li></ul>

To use Charles you need to have a WordPress 4.0 (or higher version) site with PHP 5.4 or more running on your hosting server. If you’ve already installed WordPress on your server and your site is up, that’s great. For help regarding WordPress installation, please see this <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Installing_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WordPress Codex link</a>.<strong>Some more resources from WordPress Codex:</strong><ul> 	<li><a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/First_Steps_With_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">First Steps With WordPress</a></li> 	<li><a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/FAQ_New_To_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FAQ New To WordPress</a></li></ul>

We are strongly recommended to install “Envato Toolkit” plugin for ease of use. Once necessary plugin installed and activated “Envato Toolkit” menu will be available at your admin side.<strong>Important :</strong> If you have missing plugins or having issues to install any of them, all the related could be found under “recommended-plugins” folder within the downloaded package.<h3>User Account Information</h3>To obtain your API Key, visit your “My Settings” page on any of the Envato Marketplaces. Once a valid connection has been made any changes to the API key below for this username will not effect the results for 5 minutes because they’re cached in the database. If you have already made an API connection and just purchase a theme and it’s not showing up, wait five minutes and refresh the page. If the theme is still not showing up, it’s possible the author has not made it available for auto install yet.<strong>Marketplace Username:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace username.<strong>Secret API Key:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace Secret API Key (http://themeforest.net/user/[your-username]/api_keys/edit, Login to your Themeforest account, Settings &gt; API Key)<h3>Backup Information</h3>This plugin will automatically save your theme as a ZIP archive before it does an upgrade. The directory those backups get saved to is wp-content/envato-backups. However, if you’re experiencing problems while attempting to upgrade, it’s likely to be a permissions issue and you may want to manually backup your theme before upgrading. Alternatively, if you don’t want to backup your theme you can check the box below.<strong>Skip Theme Backup:</strong> Strongly recommended keep unchecked.<h3>Alternative Way</h3>You can also update the theme by replacing the old theme folder. First go to your theme directory then delete the theme folder and paste the new version of the theme.

Go to <em><strong><span style="color: #000000;">Appearance &gt; Customize &gt; Site Identity</span>.</strong></em> Then Select an image as site icon. It's recommended to use a <strong><em>.ico</em></strong> image as the site icon (favicon).<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2218 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png" alt="" width="461" height="501" /></a>&nbsp;
Please make sure you have generated and set menus on “Appearance &gt; Menus”."Main Menu” menu locations have to be filled to make the menus work as expected.

The theme uses <a href="http://www.gravatar.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Gravatar</a> to display users avatars . to create or change your Gravatar :<h4>If you have never setup a Gravatar account:</h4><ol> 	<li>Register/login to <a href="http://www.gravatar.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Gravatar</a>. Upon registering, use the SAME email address that is associated with your WordPress User Profile.</li> 	<li>Upload your photo and associate it with that specific email address.</li></ol>&nbsp;<h4>If you already registered at gravatar.com, follow these steps:</h4><ol> 	<li>Click on "My Gravatars".</li> 	<li>click on "Add a New Email".</li> 	<li>Then, you'll need to click on "Add a New Image".</li> 	<li>Upload an image.</li> 	<li>Then select the email address, and then select your image from the bottom. Now it's associated with that email address. Click Save.</li> 	<li>It will take about 5-10 minutes to propagate on the internet, and then will appear on site.</li></ol>
How to apply custom CSS code.

You can apply your own custom CSS code on Charles theme. Your custom CSS code will not be lost even if you update the theme.Navigate to <em>Appearance &gt; Customize &gt; Additional CSS</em>Take a look at the screenshots-<a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/custom_css.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2311 size-full" src="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/custom_css.png" alt="" width="315" height="498" /></a><a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/custom_css2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2312" src="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/custom_css2.png" alt="" width="315" height="498" /></a>

<h1 class="title">Create a new page</h1><ol> 	<li>On the top left side of the WordPress dashboard, click&nbsp;<strong>Pages</strong>&nbsp;&gt;&nbsp;<strong>Add New</strong></li> 	<li>Click&nbsp;<strong>Edit with Elementor</strong>&nbsp;to enter Elementor Page Builder.</li></ol><img src="https://d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/573acfa69033602af6969ed2/images/5ae1731d04286328a4149242/file-GJnsDydf7q.gif"><hr>The website editing screen is located on the right side. This is your workspace, where you can add sections and templates.The panel is located on the left side of the screen and contains creative tools called&nbsp;<em>widgets</em>, that allow you to add elements to your page.Some of the most commonly used widgets include Button, Image, text, and more.To find a specific&nbsp;<em>widget</em>, use the search field.<img src="https://d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/573acfa69033602af6969ed2/images/5ae183212c7d3a5063b4e4c7/file-mxtbqWkKrO.gif">

Optimizing your images will helps your WordPress site load faster.Download and activate <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-smushit/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WP Smush.it</a> This plugin will optimize every image you upload and you can use the Bulk Smush.it feature to smush all of your uploaded images.Alternatives to WP Smush.it include <a title="EWWW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/ewww-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">EWWW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="CW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/cw-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="Imsanity" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/imsanity/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Imsanity</a> and <a title="Hammy" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/hammy/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Hammy</a> and <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/tiny-compress-images/">Compress JPEG &amp; PNG images</a>Many WordPress users prefer using these plugins as they do not rely on an external server to process your images.

<p class="lead">All of our Themes are able to be translated into any language. The process of translating the theme is a user responsibility. The following instructions are given as guidance.</p><ol> 	<li>Open wp-config.php and replace this: <code>define ('WPLANG', ''); </code>with this (substitute the language string (bg_BG) with your own!): <code>define ('WPLANG', 'bg_BG');</code></li> 	<li>Download and install <a href="http://www.poedit.net/download.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">POEDIT</a></li> 	<li>Connect to your site -&gt; open your theme/languages directory</li> 	<li>Download the default.pot file and open it with POEDIT.</li> 	<li>Translate file and save it as bg_BG (the file name must match with the string you inserted into wp-config.php)</li> 	<li>Two files will be generated after save. bg_BG.pot and bg_BG.mo</li> 	<li>Upload the .mo and .pot files into wp-content/themes/your-theme/languages folder</li></ol><div class="bs-callout bs-callout-warning">Your WordPress installation should be in the language you intend on using the site.</div>

Sometimes, your website may break when you update the new version of the theme.You have to delete the <strong>Charles core</strong>&nbsp;plugin before installing the updated theme in this case. Then install the plugin again from&nbsp;<em><strong>Appearance &gt; Install plugins</strong>&nbsp;</em>after installing&nbsp;the new version.
How to edit the theme Footer?

You can change the theme default Footer color and other styling (including Footer Fact Counter) from <i><b>Theme Settings &gt; Footer Settings</b></i>. And you can set the footer widgets from <em><strong>Appearance &gt; Widgets.</strong></em> Put your footer widgets into the Footer Widgets sidebar area.

<!-- wp:heading --><h2 id="overriding-parent-theme-files">OVERRIDING PARENT THEME FILES</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>You can not only target individual style declarations via the style sheet but also override entire components of the parent theme.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For every theme file present in the parent directory, WordPress will check whether a corresponding file is present in the child theme and if so, use that one instead. This means that a&nbsp;<code>header.php</code>&nbsp;file in the child theme will override its equivalent in the parent folder.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>So, if you don’t like something about a page’s layout, just copy the respective file, implement your changes, and upload it to the child theme’s folder. The modifications will then appear in the child theme, while the original file will remain untouched.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2 id="working-with-template-files">WORKING WITH TEMPLATE FILES</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>We’ve learned that we can overwrite any file in the parent theme by placing a copy in the child theme’s folder and customizing it. However, using files that&nbsp;<strong>exist only in the child theme</strong>&nbsp;is also possible. Template files are a good example of this.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Let’s say we want to build a full-width page template for our child theme. Our theme does not lend itself to the full-screen presentation, but let’s do it anyway for demonstration purposes, shall we?</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>To create a full-width page in Chaoz you have to create a custom page template. Let’s start with the page template.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For our custom page template, we simply copy&nbsp;<code>page.php</code>&nbsp;from the parent theme, rename it to&nbsp;<code>page-full-width.php</code>&nbsp;and place it in the Child theme’s root folder.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading --><h2 id="overriding-parent-theme-files">OVERRIDING PARENT THEME FILES</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>You can not only target individual style declarations via the style sheet but also override entire components of the parent theme.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For every theme file present in the parent directory, WordPress will check whether a corresponding file is present in the child theme and if so, use that one instead. This means that a&nbsp;<code>header.php</code>&nbsp;file in the child theme will override its equivalent in the parent folder.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>So, if you don’t like something about a page’s layout, just copy the respective file, implement your changes, and upload it to the child theme’s folder. The modifications will then appear in the child theme, while the original file will remain untouched.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2 id="working-with-template-files">WORKING WITH TEMPLATE FILES</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>We’ve learned that we can overwrite any file in the parent theme by placing a copy in the child theme’s folder and customizing it. However, using files that&nbsp;<strong>exist only in the child theme</strong>&nbsp;is also possible. Template files are a good example of this.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Let’s say we want to build a full-width page template for our child theme. Our theme does not lend itself to the full-screen presentation, but let’s do it anyway for demonstration purposes, shall we?</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>To create a full-width page in Chaoz you have to create a custom page template. Let’s start with the page template.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For our custom page template, we simply copy&nbsp;<code>page.php</code>&nbsp;from the parent theme, rename it to&nbsp;<code>page-full-width.php</code>&nbsp;and place it in the Child theme’s root folder.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<p class="lead">All of our Themes are able to be translated into any language. The process of translating the theme is a user responsibility. The following instructions are given as guidance.</p><ol> 	<li>Open wp-config.php and replace this: <code>define ('WPLANG', ''); </code>with this (substitute the language string (bg_BG) with your own!): <code>define ('WPLANG', 'bg_BG');</code></li> 	<li>Download and install <a href="http://www.poedit.net/download.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">POEDIT</a></li> 	<li>Connect to your site -&gt; open your theme/languages directory</li> 	<li>Download the default.pot file and open it with POEDIT.</li> 	<li>Translate file and save it as bg_BG (the file name must match with the string you inserted into wp-config.php)</li> 	<li>Two files will be generated after save. bg_BG.pot and bg_BG.mo</li> 	<li>Upload the .mo and .pot files into wp-content/themes/your-theme/languages folder</li></ol><div class="bs-callout bs-callout-warning">Your WordPress installation should be in the language you intend on using the site.</div>

Optimizing your images will helps your WordPress site load faster.Download and activate <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-smushit/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WP Smush.it</a> This plugin will optimize every image you upload and you can use the Bulk Smush.it feature to smush all of your uploaded images.Alternatives to WP Smush.it include <a title="EWWW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/ewww-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">EWWW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="CW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/cw-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="Imsanity" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/imsanity/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Imsanity</a> and <a title="Hammy" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/hammy/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Hammy</a> and <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/tiny-compress-images/">Compress JPEG &amp; PNG images</a>Many WordPress users prefer using these plugins as they do not rely on an external server to process your images.

How to apply custom CSS code.

You can apply your own custom CSS code on Charles theme. Go to <em><strong><span style="color: #000000;">Appearance &gt; Customize &gt; Site Identity</span>.</strong></em> Then Select an image as site icon. It's recommended to use a <strong><em>.ico</em></strong> image as the site icon (favicon).<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2218 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png" alt="" width="461" height="501" /></a>&nbsp;

We are strongly recommended to install “Envato Toolkit” plugin for ease of use. Once necessary plugin installed and activated “Envato Toolkit” menu will be available at your admin side.<strong>Important :</strong> If you have missing plugins or having issues to install any of them, all the related could be found under “recommended-plugins” folder within the downloaded package.<h3>User Account Information</h3>To obtain your API Key, visit your “My Settings” page on any of the Envato Marketplaces. Once a valid connection has been made any changes to the API key below for this username will not effect the results for 5 minutes because they’re cached in the database. If you have already made an API connection and just purchase a theme and it’s not showing up, wait five minutes and refresh the page. If the theme is still not showing up, it’s possible the author has not made it available for auto install yet.<strong>Marketplace Username:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace username.<strong>Secret API Key:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace Secret API Key (http://themeforest.net/user/[your-username]/api_keys/edit, Login to your Themeforest account, Settings &gt; API Key)<h3>Backup Information</h3>This plugin will automatically save your theme as a ZIP archive before it does an upgrade. The directory those backups get saved to is wp-content/envato-backups. However, if you’re experiencing problems while attempting to upgrade, it’s likely to be a permissions issue and you may want to manually backup your theme before upgrading. Alternatively, if you don’t want to backup your theme you can check the box below.<strong>Skip Theme Backup:</strong> Strongly recommended keep unchecked.<h3>Alternative Way</h3>You can also update the theme by replacing the old theme folder. First go to your theme directory then delete the theme folder and paste the new version of the theme.
<!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Before building your site, better take a look at this section.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->

To use Charles you need to have a WordPress 4.0 (or higher version) site with PHP 5.4 or more running on your hosting server. If you’ve already installed WordPress on your server and your site is up, that’s great. For help regarding WordPress installation, please see this <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Installing_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WordPress Codex link</a>.<strong>Some more resources from WordPress Codex:</strong><ul> 	<li><a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/First_Steps_With_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">First Steps With WordPress</a></li> 	<li><a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/FAQ_New_To_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FAQ New To WordPress</a></li></ul>

After installing the theme you most have to install the<strong> 'Charles Core', 'Elementor'</strong> and<strong> </strong><strong>'Piklist'</strong> plugins to import the demo content as well and work the theme correctly.You will find all required and recommended plugins at <strong><em><span style="color: #000000;">Appearance &gt; Install Plugins.</span></em></strong>

If you want your site to look like exactly the 'Charles' demos then you have to import the demo content successfully.We integrated the One Click Demo installation feature to 'Charles' WordPress theme. You can import all demo content just by a click only.<h2>OneClick Demo Installation Process</h2><ul> 	<li><a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/docs/gullu-wp/getting-started/theme-installation/">Install the theme</a> and active it. Then <a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/?p=2101">install</a> all required plugins. Make sure all the required plugins are activated.</li> 	<li>After activating all the required plugins navigate to<strong><span style="color: #000000;"> <em>Appearance &gt; 'One Click Demo Import'</em></span> </strong>menu from the WordPress dashboard.</li></ul><a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/gullu_demo_import_menu-2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2364" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/gullu_demo_import_menu-2.png" alt="" width="1329" height="659" /></a><strong>Note:</strong> If the option data do not import then you have to import it manually. Navigate to<em> <strong>'Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong></em> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/import-theme-options-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2227 size-large" src="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/import-theme-options-1024x486.png" alt="" width="625" height="297" /></a><h2><strong>The recommended method to import the demo content.</strong></h2>If you failed to import the demo content by one click then you have to follow the below steps to import the demo content manually.  You will get all demo content data with the theme package. You will find the demos in <em><strong>'charles&gt;inc/demo{disired-demo-number} </strong></em>this path.<ul> 	<li>Navigate to <strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Tools &gt; Import</em> </span></strong>then install the WordPress plugin and click on the 'Run Importer'. Upload here the 'theme_content.xml' file.</li> 	<li>Install the <em><span style="color: #000000;">'<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/widget-importer-exporter">Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</a>'</span></em> plugin to import the demo widgets. Then navigate to <strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Tools &gt; Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</em></span></strong> and upload here the <em><span style="color: #000000;">'widget_data.wie'</span></em> file.</li> 	<li>Now you have to import the Dental Options as like the demo. Navigate to '<strong>Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.</li></ul>

Extract the zipped package downloaded from ThemeForest to your desktop, in the extracted package you will find the charles<em>.zip</em> file which is the WordPress theme.You can install the theme in two ways:<pre><code>FTP: Extract charles.zip file and upload the extracted folder to /wp-content/themes/ folder on your server.WordPress: Navigate to Appearance -&gt; Add New Themes -&gt; Upload page. Select charles.zip file. Press the Install Now button to upload and install the theme.</code></pre>After uploading the theme, you have to activate it. Navigate to Appearance -&gt; Themes page to activate the theme.

<!-- wp:heading --><h2 id="overriding-parent-theme-files">OVERRIDING PARENT THEME FILES</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>You can not only target individual style declarations via the style sheet but also override entire components of the parent theme.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For every theme file present in the parent directory, WordPress will check whether a corresponding file is present in the child theme and if so, use that one instead. This means that a&nbsp;<code>header.php</code>&nbsp;file in the child theme will override its equivalent in the parent folder.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>So, if you don’t like something about a page’s layout, just copy the respective file, implement your changes, and upload it to the child theme’s folder. The modifications will then appear in the child theme, while the original file will remain untouched.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2 id="working-with-template-files">WORKING WITH TEMPLATE FILES</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>We’ve learned that we can overwrite any file in the parent theme by placing a copy in the child theme’s folder and customizing it. However, using files that&nbsp;<strong>exist only in the child theme</strong>&nbsp;is also possible. Template files are a good example of this.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Let’s say we want to build a full-width page template for our child theme. Our theme does not lend itself to the full-screen presentation, but let’s do it anyway for demonstration purposes, shall we?</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>To create a full-width page in Chaoz you have to create a custom page template. Let’s start with the page template.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For our custom page template, we simply copy&nbsp;<code>page.php</code>&nbsp;from the parent theme, rename it to&nbsp;<code>page-full-width.php</code>&nbsp;and place it in the Child theme’s root folder.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<p class="lead">All of our Themes are able to be translated into any language. The process of translating the theme is a user responsibility. The following instructions are given as guidance.</p><ol> 	<li>Open wp-config.php and replace this: <code>define ('WPLANG', ''); </code>with this (substitute the language string (bg_BG) with your own!): <code>define ('WPLANG', 'bg_BG');</code></li> 	<li>Download and install <a href="http://www.poedit.net/download.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">POEDIT</a></li> 	<li>Connect to your site -&gt; open your theme/languages directory</li> 	<li>Download the default.pot file and open it with POEDIT.</li> 	<li>Translate file and save it as bg_BG (the file name must match with the string you inserted into wp-config.php)</li> 	<li>Two files will be generated after save. bg_BG.pot and bg_BG.mo</li> 	<li>Upload the .mo and .pot files into wp-content/themes/your-theme/languages folder</li></ol><div class="bs-callout bs-callout-warning">Your WordPress installation should be in the language you intend on using the site.</div>

Optimizing your images will helps your WordPress site load faster.Download and activate <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-smushit/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WP Smush.it</a> This plugin will optimize every image you upload and you can use the Bulk Smush.it feature to smush all of your uploaded images.Alternatives to WP Smush.it include <a title="EWWW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/ewww-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">EWWW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="CW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/cw-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="Imsanity" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/imsanity/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Imsanity</a> and <a title="Hammy" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/hammy/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Hammy</a> and <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/tiny-compress-images/">Compress JPEG &amp; PNG images</a>Many WordPress users prefer using these plugins as they do not rely on an external server to process your images.

Sometimes, your website may break when you update the new version of the theme.You have to delete the <strong>Charles core</strong>&nbsp;plugin before installing the updated theme in this case. Then install the plugin again from&nbsp;<em><strong>Appearance &gt; Install plugins</strong>&nbsp;</em>after installing&nbsp;the new version.

In the Header settings section, you will get a lot of header customization options. In this section, you can change the logo and set the menu button, navigation bar settings etc.<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/header-2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2524" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/header-2.png" alt="" width="1896" height="885" /></a>

<h1 class="title">Create a new page</h1><ol> 	<li>On the top left side of the WordPress dashboard, click&nbsp;<strong>Pages</strong>&nbsp;&gt;&nbsp;<strong>Add New</strong></li> 	<li>Click&nbsp;<strong>Edit with Elementor</strong>&nbsp;to enter Elementor Page Builder.</li></ol><img src="https://d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/573acfa69033602af6969ed2/images/5ae1731d04286328a4149242/file-GJnsDydf7q.gif"><hr>The website editing screen is located on the right side. This is your workspace, where you can add sections and templates.The panel is located on the left side of the screen and contains creative tools called&nbsp;<em>widgets</em>, that allow you to add elements to your page.Some of the most commonly used widgets include Button, Image, text, and more.To find a specific&nbsp;<em>widget</em>, use the search field.<img src="https://d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/573acfa69033602af6969ed2/images/5ae183212c7d3a5063b4e4c7/file-mxtbqWkKrO.gif">

How to apply custom CSS code.

You can apply your own custom CSS code on Charles theme. Your custom CSS code will not be lost even if you update the theme.Navigate to <em>Appearance &gt; Customize &gt; Additional CSS</em>Take a look at the screenshots-<a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/custom_css.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2311 size-full" src="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/custom_css.png" alt="" width="315" height="498" /></a><a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/custom_css2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2312" src="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/custom_css2.png" alt="" width="315" height="498" /></a>

Go to <em><strong><span style="color: #000000;">Appearance &gt; Customize &gt; Site Identity</span>.</strong></em> Then Select an image as site icon. It's recommended to use a <strong><em>.ico</em></strong> image as the site icon (favicon).<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2218 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png" alt="" width="461" height="501" /></a>&nbsp;

We are strongly recommended to install “Envato Toolkit” plugin for ease of use. Once necessary plugin installed and activated “Envato Toolkit” menu will be available at your admin side.<strong>Important :</strong> If you have missing plugins or having issues to install any of them, all the related could be found under “recommended-plugins” folder within the downloaded package.<h3>User Account Information</h3>To obtain your API Key, visit your “My Settings” page on any of the Envato Marketplaces. Once a valid connection has been made any changes to the API key below for this username will not effect the results for 5 minutes because they’re cached in the database. If you have already made an API connection and just purchase a theme and it’s not showing up, wait five minutes and refresh the page. If the theme is still not showing up, it’s possible the author has not made it available for auto install yet.<strong>Marketplace Username:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace username.<strong>Secret API Key:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace Secret API Key (http://themeforest.net/user/[your-username]/api_keys/edit, Login to your Themeforest account, Settings &gt; API Key)<h3>Backup Information</h3>This plugin will automatically save your theme as a ZIP archive before it does an upgrade. The directory those backups get saved to is wp-content/envato-backups. However, if you’re experiencing problems while attempting to upgrade, it’s likely to be a permissions issue and you may want to manually backup your theme before upgrading. Alternatively, if you don’t want to backup your theme you can check the box below.<strong>Skip Theme Backup:</strong> Strongly recommended keep unchecked.<h3>Alternative Way</h3>You can also update the theme by replacing the old theme folder. First go to your theme directory then delete the theme folder and paste the new version of the theme.
<!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Before building your site, better take a look at this section.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->

To use Charles you need to have a WordPress 4.0 (or higher version) site with PHP 5.4 or more running on your hosting server. If you’ve already installed WordPress on your server and your site is up, that’s great. For help regarding WordPress installation, please see this <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Installing_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WordPress Codex link</a>.<strong>Some more resources from WordPress Codex:</strong><ul> 	<li><a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/First_Steps_With_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">First Steps With WordPress</a></li> 	<li><a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/FAQ_New_To_WordPress" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FAQ New To WordPress</a></li></ul>

After installing the theme you most have to install the<strong> 'Charles Core', 'Elementor'</strong> and<strong> </strong><strong>'Piklist'</strong> plugins to import the demo content as well and work the theme correctly.You will find all required and recommended plugins at <strong><em><span style="color: #000000;">Appearance &gt; Install Plugins.</span></em></strong>

If you want your site to look like exactly the 'Charles' demos then you have to import the demo content successfully.We integrated the One Click Demo installation feature to 'Charles' WordPress theme. You can import all demo content just by a click only.<h2>OneClick Demo Installation Process</h2><ul> 	<li><a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/docs/gullu-wp/getting-started/theme-installation/">Install the theme</a> and active it. Then <a href="http://docs.creativegigs.net/?p=2101">install</a> all required plugins. Make sure all the required plugins are activated.</li> 	<li>After activating all the required plugins navigate to<strong><span style="color: #000000;"> <em>Appearance &gt; 'One Click Demo Import'</em></span> </strong>menu from the WordPress dashboard.</li></ul><a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/gullu_demo_import_menu-2.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2364" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/gullu_demo_import_menu-2.png" alt="" width="1329" height="659" /></a><strong>Note:</strong> If the option data do not import then you have to import it manually. Navigate to<em> <strong>'Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong></em> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/import-theme-options-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2227 size-large" src="http://docs.creativegigs.net/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/import-theme-options-1024x486.png" alt="" width="625" height="297" /></a><h2><strong>The recommended method to import the demo content.</strong></h2>If you failed to import the demo content by one click then you have to follow the below steps to import the demo content manually.  You will get all demo content data with the theme package. You will find the demos in <em><strong>'charles&gt;inc/demo{disired-demo-number} </strong></em>this path.<ul> 	<li>Navigate to <strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Tools &gt; Import</em> </span></strong>then install the WordPress plugin and click on the 'Run Importer'. Upload here the 'theme_content.xml' file.</li> 	<li>Install the <em><span style="color: #000000;">'<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/widget-importer-exporter">Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</a>'</span></em> plugin to import the demo widgets. Then navigate to <strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Tools &gt; Widget Importer &amp; Exporter</em></span></strong> and upload here the <em><span style="color: #000000;">'widget_data.wie'</span></em> file.</li> 	<li>Now you have to import the Dental Options as like the demo. Navigate to '<strong>Theme Settings &gt; Backup'.</strong> Then copy-paste the backup string here and click on the Import a Backup button. You will find the backup string in the <em><strong>options.txt</strong></em> file.</li></ul>

Extract the zipped package downloaded from ThemeForest to your desktop, in the extracted package you will find the charles<em>.zip</em> file which is the WordPress theme.You can install the theme in two ways:<pre><code>FTP: Extract charles.zip file and upload the extracted folder to /wp-content/themes/ folder on your server.WordPress: Navigate to Appearance -&gt; Add New Themes -&gt; Upload page. Select charles.zip file. Press the Install Now button to upload and install the theme.</code></pre>After uploading the theme, you have to activate it. Navigate to Appearance -&gt; Themes page to activate the theme.

It's recommended to use a <strong><em>.ico</em></strong> image as the site icon (favicon).<a href="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png"><img class="alignnone wp-image-2218 size-full" src="https://wordpress-theme.spider-themes.net/docy/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/favicon-2.png" alt="" width="461" height="501" /></a>&nbsp;

We are strongly recommended to install “Envato Toolkit” plugin for ease of use. Once necessary plugin installed and activated “Envato Toolkit” menu will be available at your admin side.<strong>Important :</strong> If you have missing plugins or having issues to install any of them, all the related could be found under “recommended-plugins” folder within the downloaded package.<h3>User Account Information</h3>To obtain your API Key, visit your “My Settings” page on any of the Envato Marketplaces. Once a valid connection has been made any changes to the API key below for this username will not effect the results for 5 minutes because they’re cached in the database. If you have already made an API connection and just purchase a theme and it’s not showing up, wait five minutes and refresh the page. If the theme is still not showing up, it’s possible the author has not made it available for auto install yet.<strong>Marketplace Username:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace username.<strong>Secret API Key:</strong> Enter your Envato marketplace Secret API Key (http://themeforest.net/user/[your-username]/api_keys/edit, Login to your Themeforest account, Settings &gt; API Key)<h3>Backup Information</h3>This plugin will automatically save your theme as a ZIP archive before it does an upgrade. The directory those backups get saved to is wp-content/envato-backups. However, if you’re experiencing problems while attempting to upgrade, it’s likely to be a permissions issue and you may want to manually backup your theme before upgrading. Alternatively, if you don’t want to backup your theme you can check the box below.<strong>Skip Theme Backup:</strong> Strongly recommended keep unchecked.<h3>Alternative Way</h3>You can also update the theme by replacing the old theme folder. First go to your theme directory then delete the theme folder and paste the new version of the theme.

<p class="lead">All of our Themes are able to be translated into any language. The process of translating the theme is a user responsibility. The following instructions are given as guidance.</p><ol> 	<li>Open wp-config.php and replace this: <code>define ('WPLANG', ''); </code>with this (substitute the language string (bg_BG) with your own!): <code>define ('WPLANG', 'bg_BG');</code></li> 	<li>Download and install <a href="http://www.poedit.net/download.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">POEDIT</a></li> 	<li>Connect to your site -&gt; open your theme/languages directory</li> 	<li>Download the default.pot file and open it with POEDIT.</li> 	<li>Translate file and save it as bg_BG (the file name must match with the string you inserted into wp-config.php)</li> 	<li>Two files will be generated after save. bg_BG.pot and bg_BG.mo</li> 	<li>Upload the .mo and .pot files into wp-content/themes/your-theme/languages folder</li></ol><div class="bs-callout bs-callout-warning">Your WordPress installation should be in the language you intend on using the site.</div>

Optimizing your images will helps your WordPress site load faster.Download and activate <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-smushit/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WP Smush.it</a> This plugin will optimize every image you upload and you can use the Bulk Smush.it feature to smush all of your uploaded images.Alternatives to WP Smush.it include <a title="EWWW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/ewww-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">EWWW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="CW Image Optimizer" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/cw-image-optimizer/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CW Image Optimizer</a>, <a title="Imsanity" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/imsanity/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Imsanity</a> and <a title="Hammy" href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/hammy/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Hammy</a> and <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/tiny-compress-images/">Compress JPEG &amp; PNG images</a>Many WordPress users prefer using these plugins as they do not rely on an external server to process your images.
